A central figure of the tragedy at Belhalla.
Brought three children into the world as
dictated by the whims of fate. Appears in
Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War.
Haimura Kiyotaka (はいむらきよたか)

Legendary Effect: Earth
Ally Boost: HP+3, Atk+2

Grants allies this Legendary Effect
during Earth season, if the Earth
blessing has been conferred and if
this unit enters battle with them.

Standard Effect 1: Duel
If unit is 5★ and level 40 and unit's stats total
less than 190, treats unit's stats as 190 in
modes like Arena. (Higher-scoring opponents
will appear. Stat total calculation excludes any
values added by merges and skills.)
Standard Effect 2: Pair Up
An ability that can only be used under certain
circumstances. Pair Up can be accessed from
the Interact with Allies menu, and allows this
unit to join battle in a group with another ally.

Can effectively get Atk/Res+33, is
strong against dragons, and can live
through a fatal blow to crush foes.

Accelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
Effective against dragon foes. If unit is within
3 spaces of an ally, inflicts Atk/Res-6 on foe
during combat, unit makes a guaranteed
follow-up attack, disables foe's skills that
"calculate damage using the lower of foe's
Def or Res," and also, if unit's Res > foe's Res
at start of combat, inflicts penalty on foe's
Atk/Res during combat = 80% of difference
between Res stats at start of combat.
(Maximum penalty of -12.)

Boosts Special damage by 40% of unit's Res.
If unit's HP > 1, foe would reduce unit's HP
to 0, and both following conditions apply, unit
survives with 1 HP:
  - Unit or foe's Special is ready, or unit or
    foe's Special triggered during this combat.
  - Unit initiates combat or foe's Range = 2.
(Once per map. Considered a non-Special
effect. Does not stack with non-Special
effects that allow unit to survive with 1 HP
if foe's attack would reduce HP to 0.)

Inflicts Atk/Res-1 on foe and neutralizes effects
that grant "Special cooldown charge +X" to foe
or inflict "Special cooldown charge -X" on unit
during combat.

Inflicts Atk/Res-2 on foe and neutralizes effects
that grant "Special cooldown charge +X" to foe
or inflict "Special cooldown charge -X" on unit
during combat.

Inflicts Atk/Res-3 on foe and neutralizes effects
that grant "Special cooldown charge +X" to foe
or inflict "Special cooldown charge -X" on unit
during combat.

The dragon forces, along with their
leader, the Demon Dragon, were
thought to have been defeated in
the Scouring. The Demon Dragon
survived, however, and was revived
thousands of years later. Jahn, the
last fire dragon in Elibe, spent the
intervening years recovering from
the Scouring within the Dragon
Temple. When the Demon Dragon
was revived, he sensed her return...

Guinivere, Zephiel's sister, turned
away from Bern and sought the help
of the Lycian League. She hoped to
put a stop to the violence and find a
way back to peace. And in so doing,
placed her trust in Bern's enemies...

Although the Lycian League was
under the protection of Etruria, a
faction within it aligned with Bern.
Their wish to perform a coup served
to sow disorder within the League.
Taking advantage, Zephiel managed
to capture his sister, but she slipped
from his grasp with the aid of a loyal
retainer. The once-close siblings thus
parted, each unable to understand
the other...

The Lycian League was able to
defeat the coup-seeking faction
and recovered Etruria's capital.
Guinivere entrusted Roy, the leader
of the League's forces, with the Fire
Emblem as the fight against her
brother loomed ahead of them. With
it, Roy could gather the treasure of
Bern, the Binding Blade that once
defeated the dragons in ages past...

Zephiel, the once-gentle prince, had
been the target of his father's ire and
resentment—which led to the king
planning Zephiel's assassination.
Losing faith in humanity, the prince
killed his father and took the throne.
As king, he wished to use his strength
to free the world of its treacherous
people and return it to the dragons...

The Lycian League invaded Bern's
capital and confronted Zephiel
himself. After a fierce battle, Zephiel
fell, and it seemed his ambitions
would go unfulfilled. The dark
priestess who had been ever at
his side, however, still remained
at large.
